meanings.definition: Not wise or prudent; lacking in political acumen.
meanings.sent1: His unpolitic decision led to serious consequences.
meanings.sent2: It was unpolitic of her to trust a stranger with her savings.
meanings.sent3: The unpolitic move of wearing pajamas to a job interview raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: Her unpolitic choices in the game made her an easy target for her opponents.
meanings.sent5: The unpolitic behavior of the new employee stood out among the seasoned professionals.

meanings.definition: Not suitable for achieving political goals; imprudent.
meanings.sent1: Using such unpolitic methods will only harm your campaign.
meanings.sent2: The candidate's unpolitic speeches alienated many potential supporters.
meanings.sent3: It was unpolitic to try to win votes by insulting the voters.
meanings.sent4: Her unpolitic strategy backfired, causing her to lose the election.
meanings.sent5: The unpolitic approach of the party leader led to internal conflicts.

meanings.sent1: His unpolitic remarks offended the entire audience.
meanings.sent2: She regretted her unpolitic comment as soon as it left her mouth.
meanings.sent3: It was unpolitic to bring up such a sensitive topic at the dinner table.
meanings.sent4: The unpolitic email sparked a heated debate within the company.
meanings.sent5: Her unpolitic behavior at the diplomatic event caused a diplomatic incident.
